byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Ferguson, Mo, announces amnesty for thousands of arrest warrants for municipal violations and says it will work toward limiting jail sentences for people who cannot pay fines and fees; city's court system received federal scrutiny over law enforcement's treatment of blacks following shooting of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown by white officer.
lead_paragraph: The efforts are a response to the sharp criticism of the court system in the Missouri city that emerged after the killing of Michael Brown last year.

headline.main: Ferguson Announces an Amnesty on Warrants
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Announces an Amnesty on Warrants

snippet: The efforts are a response to the sharp criticism of the court system in the Missouri city that emerged after the killing of Michael Brown last year.
